kernel_alpha.reasoning: Both conditions are simple, side-effect-free comparisons on independent variables (i and j) against their bounds (m and n). Neither condition modifies any state, and i/j are not changed between checks. Coalescing to a single if (i < m && j < n) preserves behavior (body executes only when both are true) and improves readability by removing unnecessary nesting and making the combined bounds guard explicit.
